sentences.english: Pre-Socratic natural Philosopher, member of the Ionian School.
sentences.chinese: 前苏格拉底自然哲学家，伊奥尼亚学派成员。

sentences.english: This is the doctrine of the nominalist party.
sentences.chinese: 这是唯名主义学派的学说。

sentences.english: Though research on its origin and evolution, direct followers like Da…
sentences.chinese: 明代丹溪学派对祖国医学的发展起到重要作用。

sentences.english: Many schools of paintings were in these periods.
sentences.chinese: 在这个时期产生了许多绘画学派。

sentences.english: But French School did not hold in esteem the concept of world literature.
sentences.chinese: 但是，“世界文学”的概念并不被法国学派所推重。

sentences.english: Yale University Department of English and literature have been critical of the new school movement.
sentences.chinese: 耶鲁大学的英文和文学系曾属于新批判运动学派。

sentences.english: The Stoics developed three eidetic reductions of future misfortune.
sentences.chinese: 禁欲学派对于预测灾难发展三个心象的推论。

sentences.english: Historiography in the 20th century's most dazzling star of the Annales school in France.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪史学中最耀眼的新星是法国的年鉴学派。

sentences.english: Before it occurs, a number of schools compete for the domination of a given field.
sentences.chinese: 在它发生之前，这一领域中有许多学派在逐鹿中原。

sentences.english: He is a famous Stoic philosopher.
sentences.chinese: 他是知名的斯多葛学派哲学家。

sentences.english: That is the genre what later called Bauhaus.
sentences.chinese: 这种学派后来被称为包豪斯学派。

sentences.english: That is the genre what later called Bauhaus.
sentences.chinese: 这种学派后来被称为包豪斯学派。

sentences.english: Prof. Wiliamson is one of the major representatives of neo-institutionalists in America.
sentences.chinese: 威廉姆森是美国新制度经济学派的主要代表人物之一。

sentences.english: The last chapter evaluates the historical significance as well as the categorization of Shen Zi's theories.
sentences.chinese: 第六章即最后一章述评慎子的学派归属及历史地位。

sentences.english: He was at the head of a school towards the end of the last reign.
sentences.chinese: 他在前朝末年曾创立一个学派。

sentences.english: And Wang Yizhou said what the"China School"really needs is the time and more study.
sentences.chinese: 王逸舟等表示中国理论水到渠成，不应急于苛求学派。

definition: Former Han dynasty school of Confucian scholars

Legalist School of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC) founded by Han Fei 韓非|韩非[Han2 Fei1] and Li Si 李斯[Li3 Si1], later adopted by Shang Yang 商鞅[Shang1 Yang1] whose reforms helped establish the supremacy of the Qin Dynasty 秦代[Qin1 dai4] (221-207 BC)
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
Former Han dynasty school of Confucian scholars

School of Principle/Neo-Confucian Rationalistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Cheng Hao 程顥|程颢[Cheng2 Hao4], Cheng Yi 程頤|程颐[Cheng2 Yi2] and Zhu Xi 朱熹[Zhu1 xi1])
